citation.article-title: Aestuariibacter salexigens gen. nov., sp. nov. and Aestuariibacter halophilus sp. nov., isolated from tidal flat sediment, and emended description of Alteromonas macleodii.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aestuariibacter (Aes.tu.ar.i.i.bac′ter. L. neut. n. aestuarium -i tidal flat; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Aestuariibacter rod-shaped bacterium from tidal flat).
Strictly aerobic, chemoheterotrophic, halophilic, mesophilic and neutrophilic.
Cells are rod-shaped and motile with a polar flagellum.
Abundant growth occurs on MA, CSY-3 and SMM media.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c and a mixture of C16 : 1ω7c and iso-C15 : 0 2-OH.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the family Alteromonadaceae and currently contains two species.
The type species is Aestuariibacter salexigens.
